item.title: Make (formerly Integromat)
item.description:
What is Make?

A visual automation platform (formerly Integromat) that connects apps into automated workflows called “scenarios.” Drag-and-drop interface with powerful data transformation, routing, and error handling. More capable than Zapier for complex workflows, easier to start than n8n.

Who is it for?

  • Best for: Solo builders who want powerful automation without self-hosting or DevOps
  • Not for: People who only need 2-3 simple automations (Zapier is easier) or people who want full control (n8n)
  • Solo builder score: ⭐⭐⭐⭐☆ (4/5)

What does it cost?

Plan Price What You Get
Free $0 1,000 ops/mo, 2 scenarios
Core $9/mo 10,000 ops/mo
Pro $16/mo Custom functions, priority

Hidden costs: Operations count up fast with complex workflows. One scenario run might use 10-50 operations.

item.title: n8n
item.description:
What is n8n?

A visual workflow automation platform. Connect triggers (new email, webhook, schedule) to actions (send message, update database, call API) using a drag-and-drop editor. Like Zapier or Make, but open-source and self-hostable. When the visual editor isn’t enough, drop into JavaScript or Python.

Who is it for?

  • Best for: Solo builders who want to automate repetitive tasks — content pipelines, data collection, notifications, API orchestration
  • Not for: People who need 2-3 simple automations (Zapier is easier for basic stuff)
  • Solo builder score: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ (5/5)

What does it cost?

Plan Price What You Get
Self-hosted $0 Unlimited everything
Cloud Starter $20/mo 2,500 executions
Cloud Pro $50/mo 10,000 executions

Hidden costs: Self-hosting needs a server ($5-10/mo VPS) and some DevOps knowledge. Cloud pricing scales with usage.

item.title: The Faceless YouTube Stack
item.description:
The Faceless YouTube Stack

A complete YouTube channel without showing your face or hiring anyone. AI writes your scripts, generates your voice, creates your visuals, and you just edit and upload. Channels using this approach are pulling 10K–100K+ views per video in niches like finance, history, tech explainers, and motivation.

Who It’s For

  • Best for: Side-hustlers, niche content creators, and anyone who wants YouTube ad revenue without being on camera.
  • Not for: Vloggers, personality-driven creators, or anyone whose audience expects a human face. Also not ideal if you need real-world footage (travel, cooking).

The Tools

Tool Role Cost
Claude Script writing — research, outlines, full scripts $20/mo
ElevenLabs AI voiceover — natural narration $5–22/mo
Stable Diffusion / Midjourney Visual generation — backgrounds, illustrations, thumbnails $0–10/mo
CapCut / DaVinci Resolve Video editing — assembly, captions, effects $0 (free tiers)

Premium (all paid tiers + stock footage sub) ~$70/mo

Freedom Score: ⭐⭐⭐⭐☆ (4/5)

  • Why 4: You own your channel, your scripts, and your video files. Voice and images are generated fresh each time. Swapping any single tool is straightforward.
  • Lock-in risk: Minimal. The only real dependency is your YouTube channel itself — but that’s the distribution, not the tooling.

Getting Started (This Weekend)

  1. Pick your niche. Top faceless niches: personal finance, AI/tech explainers, history, psychology, “top 10” lists, motivation. Pick one you can talk about for 100 videos.
  2. Set up Claude. Create a system prompt: “You are a YouTube scriptwriter for a [niche] channel. Scripts should be 8-12 minutes of spoken content with visual cues in brackets.”
  3. Generate your first script. Ask Claude for a script on a trending topic in your niche. Include hook, body, CTA.
  4. Record voiceover in ElevenLabs. Paste the script, pick a voice, download the MP3.
  5. Generate visuals. Use the visual cues from your script to prompt Stable Diffusion or Midjourney. Aim for 15-25 images per video.
  6. Assemble in CapCut or DaVinci Resolve. Drop in narration, layer visuals on the timeline, add auto-captions, background music, transitions.
  7. Upload and optimize. Use Claude to write your title, description, and tags.

Expected output: 2-3 videos/week. Each video takes 3-5 hours start to finish once you have a rhythm.

item.title: Tools for Newsletter Automation
item.description:
Tools for Newsletter Automation

Build and run a newsletter with AI handling the heavy lifting — research, writing, formatting, and scheduling.

Writing & Research

  • Claude — Draft full newsletter editions from bullet points or topic prompts. Excellent at maintaining consistent voice across issues. Use Projects to store your style guide and past editions.
  • Kimi K2.5 — Great for research-heavy newsletters. Feed it multiple sources and get synthesized summaries.

Design & Formatting

  • Cursor — Build custom newsletter templates in HTML/CSS. Automate formatting with scripts that convert markdown drafts to email-ready HTML.

Voiceover (Audio Newsletters)

  • ElevenLabs — Turn your newsletter into a podcast-style audio version. Growing trend — readers love having an audio option.

Sending & Management

  • Beehiiv — Newsletter platform with free tier up to 2,500 subscribers. Built-in analytics, referral program, and monetization.
  • ConvertKit (Kit) — Creator-focused email platform. Visual automations, tagging, segmentation.
  • Buttondown — Minimal, markdown-first newsletter tool. Great for developers and writers who want simplicity.

Automation & Scheduling

  • Zapier / Make — Connect your writing tools to your sending platform. Auto-publish drafts on a schedule.
  • Cursor — Build custom automation scripts: RSS-to-newsletter, auto-curate links, format and schedule sends via API.

Recommended Workflow

  1. Curate topics throughout the week (Obsidian or a simple note)
  2. Feed topics to Claude → get a full draft
  3. Edit in 15 minutes (your voice, your opinions — AI does the heavy lifting)
  4. Format with your template
  5. Schedule send in Beehiiv/ConvertKit
  6. Optionally generate audio version with ElevenLabs

Time per issue: 45-90 minutes instead of 4+ hours.

item.title: The 30-Minute Video Pipeline
item.description:
What is this?

A step-by-step workflow for producing a complete YouTube video using AI tools. From blank page to uploaded video in under an hour of active work.

The Stack

Step Tool Time
Script Claude / GPT 15 min
Voiceover ElevenLabs 2 min
Audio cleanup ffmpeg (automated) 30 sec
Visuals Gemini 3 Pro 5 min
Assembly Kdenlive 20 min
Total ~45 min

The Workflow

Step 1: Script (15 min)

Use Claude or GPT to draft the script. Provide your topic, target length, and tone. Review and tweak — don’t accept the first draft.
